description: Requiring libsecret after installation
Had been using the web client of my mail provider but Mailspring has converted me, all good so far!

As a long time Mac user and recent GNU/Linux convert I've been quite dissapointed with the email software available here. When webmail is the best option, that says something. 

Then I found Mailspring. This is SO much better than any alternative I've found for Linux so far. I know with the new support and direction behind Thunderbird it has potential, but it's not there yet. Mailspring is even better imho than the Apple Mail app in it's ease of use, flexibility, and features. The free version has everything I need and after time if I feel like I want to use the extra features in the paid version, the small price is definitely worth it to support the developers. 

If you haven't tried it out yet, I strongly recommend it!

It just works. I don't have to faff around.

Es una aplicación buena y bastante estable en general. Aún le falta trabajo para que sea 100% estable y funcional, pero es muy prometedora. La función de los calendarios también es importante que quede implementada.

Al fin un cliente de correo para Linux que no parece sacado de un lugar dudoso del año 1998. La interfaz es pulida, y hasta ahora todo ha ido bien. Sincroniza bien con 365 y otros correos así que todo va bonito. Felicidades a los creadores!

Mailspring es mi aplicación favorita para enviar y recibir correos, tiene un diseño bonito y unas opciones muy prácticas para el trabajo, ojalá existiera una versión para iOS para poder usarla en mi iPhone, sería lo máximo.
summary: La mejor App de correo para GNU/Linux

description:
One the best email client. Not only it is efficient, packed with features, but the UI is also way nicer than say Thunderbird or Geary or Evolution. 
Which it makes it even more baffling when some of the most basic features have been missing for years. The ability to configure a default websafe font for our messages, which is something I had always used. Hopefully this will be addressed. 

So not perfect, but overall a great email client, one of the very best.
